metadata.title: CVE-2017-16228 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Dulwich before 0.18.5, when an SSH subprocess is used, allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary commands via an ssh URL with an initial dashcharacter in the hostname, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800,CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-12976, CVE-2017-1000116, and CVE-2017-1000117.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-dulwich - 0.18.5-1
python-dulwich - 0.18.5-1
python3-dulwich - 0.18.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dulwich package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.5-1').
